etymology.description: 北(北) (běi, "north") + 方(方) (fāng, "direction; region") = northern direction or region
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 北(北) (běi, "north") and 方(方) (fāng, "direction; region") refers to the northern direction or area. This word is used to indicate the region or direction towards the north, often describing the northern parts of a country or territory.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢北方的风景(我喜歡北方的風景)。
examples.english: I like the scenery of the north.

examples.chinese: 冬天到来时(冬天到來時)，北方寒风刺骨(北方寒風刺骨)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān dàolái shí, běifāng hánfēng cìgǔ.
examples.english: When winter comes, the northern cold wind is piercing.
